Description: Postcard; printed paper; monochrome (black and white) photograph showing the Semaphore in MEX, Alexandria.
Curator's comments: Old card; postally used. Message reads: "4-I would act if I could be with you - but I can't. How have you spent today, dear? You must write me a very full account of Easter holidays because they mean so much to you & they used to me. Shall we go to Denham on Monday? You remember what a lovely place that was, don't you? Well, dear it is getting rather late so I must kiss you goodnight. May I ..." Message continues from EPH-ME 2931 and concludes on 2933.
